ipoly.ml module#

class ipoly.ml.SavePretrainedCallback(output_dir)#

Bases: Callback

on_epoch_end(_epoch, _logs=None)#

Called at the end of an epoch.

Subclasses should override for any actions to run. This function should only be called during TRAIN mode.

Parameters:

  • epoch – Integer, index of epoch.

  • logs – Dict, metric results for this training epoch, and for the validation epoch if validation is performed. Validation result keys are prefixed with val_. For training epoch, the values of the Model’s metrics are returned. Example: {‘loss’: 0.2, ‘accuracy’: 0.7}.

ipoly.ml.compile_model(model, optimizer_type, learning_rate, is_regression)#
ipoly.ml.compute_position(sentence, target, tokenizer)#

Compute the first token of the targeted word in the sentence

ipoly.ml.croper(image, margin=18)#

Crop the white areason the borders of the input image.

Parameters:

  • image (array) – The input image.

  • margin (int) – The margin in pixels kept around the image.

Return type:

array

Returns:

The cropped image.

ipoly.ml.get_weighted_loss(pos_weights, neg_weights, epsilon=1e-07)#

This function will compute the loss function of the model.

Parameters:

  • pos_weights – Positive frequencies of weights.

  • neg_weights – Negative frequencies of weights.

  • epsilon – To not divide by 0.

Returns:

The loss classic function for the lost function.

ipoly.ml.plot(title=None, xlabel=None, ylabel=None, figsize=None, grid=False, xticks=None, yticks=None)#
ipoly.ml.plot_confusion_matrix(y_pred, y_true, labels=None)#

Plot the confusion matrix.

It determines by itself if it has to plot a simple confusion matrix or multiple ones in case of multilabel classification.

Parameters:

  • y_pred (NDArray[Any, integer]) – Predicted logits.

  • y_true (NDArray[Any, integer]) – True labels.

  • labels (Optional[Iterable[str]]) – Labels name. Need to be specified only if it is a multilabel classification.

ipoly.ml.plot_correlation_matrix(df)#

Plot the correlation matrix of your DataFrame.

Parameters:

df (DataFrame) – The input DataFrame.

Return type:

None

ipoly.ml.plot_history(history, keys=None)#

Plot the history of a Tensorflow training for each metrics.

Parameters:

  • history – The history to plot.

  • keys (Optional[list[str]]) – List of all metrics that will be plot.Plot all metrics if not specified.

Return type:

None

ipoly.ml.prepare_table(df, y='', correlation_threshold=0.9, missing_rows_threshold=0.9, missing_columns_threshold=0.6, categories_ratio_threshold=0.1, id_correlation_threshold=0.04, verbose=False)#

Prepare the table to feed a ML model. :type df: DataFrame :param df: str, Optional :type y: str | list[str] :param y: :type correlation_threshold: float :param correlation_threshold: :type missing_rows_threshold: float :param missing_rows_threshold: :type missing_columns_threshold: float :param missing_columns_threshold: :type categories_ratio_threshold: float :param categories_ratio_threshold: :type id_correlation_threshold: float :param id_correlation_threshold: :rtype: Tuple[DataFrame, DataFrame] :return:
